Science Relay looks great! 

Have just played with it, and I do have a question - will it let you relay over a control network even without <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> access? What I'm thinking of doing is creating a mothership that can drop probes while it does flybys, collect data from the probes, then pass all that data on to <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> at a later time (after the probe meets its fiery demise). IS there a way to do that I'm just not seeing?

Any vessel that has either a direct connection to the active vessel, or a chain of relays that connects back to the active vessel is a possible receiver, it doesn't care about access to the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> or control networks. The only thing that is required is a valid connection and a module science container (which all command pods, some probe cores and the new science container have), or, depending on your settings, a lab.

So as long as your drones have an antenna and an unobstructed line-of-site (using the stock planet occlusion system) back to the mothership they should be able to transmit. The transmissions take up time and electricity just like regular transmissions.

There's an "EVAComms and Supplies" mod on CurseForge but it's for 1.1.  Dunno if it works in 1.2, but probably worth a try.

For anyone else interested in using EVA Kerbals to transmit results see these two threads:

<iframe data-embedcontent="" frameborder="0" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/150084-eva-antenna-mod/&do=embed"></iframe><iframe data-embedcontent="" frameborder="0" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/150172-fyi-you-can-now-add-modules-to-kerbals/&do=embed"></iframe>

Kerbals now have regular part config files in the GameData folder. So you can add a short range antenna either directly to the config file or use <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> to do the same. The only real snag is that transmissions require a stupid amount of EC, so maybe set the EC requirements very low (packetResourceCost in the antenna config, I think), or give the Kerbal a huge battery.

[@FirroSeranel](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/144343-firroseranel/) I'll release an update soon that checks the position of the window and adds the settings panel above or below it. It will also only allow for one settings window to be open at a time, which will alleviate all the hassle of trying to position multiple panels (and I'll probably be adding a Maneuver node panel and adjusting the existing Target panel at some point, which would further complicate the situation). Also, there is a settings file in the BasicOrbit/PluginData folder that you can use to change which readout modules are active if the windows still don't work right.
